intro: Tibouchina gayana, commonly known as the pink trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Tibouchina gayana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
